model_solution:
Apply the distributive property to each term in the first polynomial: 
(2x^5 + 3x^2)(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) = 2x^5(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) + 3x^2(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8)
Apply the distributive property to each term in the second polynomial:
2x^5(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) + 3x^2(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) = 2x^5(x^4) + 2x^5(-4x^2) + 2x^5(3x) + 2x^5(-8) + 3x^2(x^4) + 3x^2(-4x^2) + 3x^2(3x) + 3x^2(-8)
Combine like terms:
2x^5(x^4) + 2x^5(-4x^2) + 2x^5(3x) + 2x^5(-8) + 3x^2(x^4) + 3x^2(-4x^2) + 3x^2(3x) + 3x^2(-8) = 2x^9 - 8x^7 + 6x^6 - 16x^5 + 3x^6 - 12x^4 + 9x^3 - 24x^2
Combine like terms:
2x^9 - 8x^7 + 6x^6 - 16x^5 + 3x^6 - 12x^4 + 9x^3 - 24x^2 = 2x^9 - 8x^7 + 9x^6 - 16x^5 - 12x^4 + 9x^3 - 24x^2
There is no next step. The problem has been completely solved:
Final Answer: $2x^9 - 8x^7 + 9x^6 - 16x^5 - 12x^4 + 9x^3 - 24x^2$
steps:

full_steps:

(2x^5 + 3x^2)(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) = 2x^5(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) + 3x^2(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8)

Apply the distributive property to each term in the second polynomial:
2x^5(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) + 3x^2(x^4 - 4x^2 + 3x - 8) = 2x^5(x^4) + 2x^5(-4x^2) + 2x^5(3x) + 2x^5(-8) + 3x^2(x^4) + 3x^2(-4x^2) + 3x^2(3x) + 3x^2(-8)
